SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - AUGUST 1st 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. North of the OURCQ, the French launched an attack this morning and have made good progress capturing BEUGNEUX and CRAMAILLE. The line now runs as follows:- Western edge of BOIS D'ARCY, North of SERVENAY - LEMONT JOUR (S.E. of LAUNOY) - 600 yards N. of COURDOUX. American troops have also made some progress North and East of FERE EN TARDENOIS and in the neighbourhood of SAPONAY. A hostile attack this morning against MONT DE BLIGNY was repulsed.
(b) British Front. There is no change in the general situation.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 6.20 p.m.
August 1st, 1918.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
